TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UriMatcher extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Utility class to aid in matching URIs in content providers.

remarks.para: Utility class to aid in matching URIs in content providers.
To use this class, build up a tree of UriMatcher objects. For example:
Starting from API level android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#JELLY_BEAN_MR2, paths can start with a leading slash. For example:

Then when you need to match against a URI, call #match, providing the URL that you have been given. You can use the result to build a query, return a type, insert or delete a row, or whatever you need, without duplicating all of the if-else logic that you would otherwise need. For example:

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void AddURI (string? authority, string? path, int code);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddURI(string authority, string path, int32 code) cil managed
abstract member AddURI : string * string * int -> unit override this.AddURI : string * string * int -> unit

Docs.param: the path to match. * may be used as a wild card for any text, and # may be used as a wild card for numbers.
the code that is returned when a URI is matched against the given components. Must be positive.
Docs.summary: Add a URI to match, and the code to return when this URI is matched.

remarks.para: Add a URI to match, and the code to return when this URI is matched. URI nodes may be exact match string, the token "*" that matches any text, or the token "#" that matches only numbers.
Starting from API level android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#JELLY_BEAN_MR2, this method will accept a leading slash in the path.

Docs.param: The url whose path we will match against.
Docs.summary: Try to match against the path in a url.
Docs.returns: The code for the matched node (added using addURI), or -1 if there is no matched node.

remarks.para: Try to match against the path in a url.
